People that say it is impossible to be original nowadays should look at Portal 2. It has the best writing in any video game I have played, but it feels like an attempt to cover up shallow puzzle solving and the fact that the game is only around eight hours long. I suggest getting it, but be careful.

If you like idiots in control of big computers, old jokes, new jokes, potatoes, science, fake science, SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAACCCCCCEEEEE, or any combination of the above, get this game.

A sequal to possibly the best game in existance and it does well to match up to it. While it will never be as godly as the original this still beats the best of games as it expands on the first game with much more gameplay, characters and storyline. The singleplayer campaign is funny, imaginative and enteraining throughout and the Co-op mode supports this with a number of levels where people can pair up to complete many easy to hard challenges.
To be brief: A worthy sequel.

When I heard about the process that this game underwent, from conception, to development, to release. It was pleasantly surprising how solid the story particularly ended up being, despite developing as the game was being developed, granted I realise the original Portal, didn't have nearly as much in terms of story, outside of GLaDOS' characterisation or the world building, but this game story developed felt so organic and made you want to learn more about the world and it's characters in a way that felt natural. Additionally I really appreciated that a lot of the story telling is via the world building and you putting the pieces together. I liked GLaDOS in the original game, but the further exploration of her character was excellent.

Portal is definitely one of those properties, that really stands out among Valve's catalogue of games, unique concept and gameplay, interesting world, strange and fun characters and a very engaging puzzle game, I feel like a lot of puzzle games fall short in terms of only giving you a puzzle, but then nothing more of substance, but this game made me really have an appreciation for what a puzzle game could be.

It's so hard to fault this game, yeah it was a childhood classic, but despite that, it holds up excellently. I remember how excited I was seeing the promotional stuff, in anticipation for it's eventual release. I have never had a similar experience since.

Do I recommend this? Without a doubt, absolutely, even if you get motion sick easily, please try and bare through it, this game is so rewarding and deserves all the love it's received. As well as expanding on everything in the first game, additionally it adds a nice bonus story via the multiplayer and also gives you the ability to create your own test chambers.

Last thoughts: You don't necessarily have to have beat the first game to play this one, but I recommend it, because for one, it's not very long and also adds additional context for the events of this game, another reason I would encourage you to play the first, is because this game is an upgrade of the first in every way, so it made feel like a degrade, going from this game to that one, lastly both games have catchy credit songs you should hear.

That's all my thoughts I hope you try it out, thanks!

Juste une merveille à jouer en solo, aussi bien dans les mécaniques de jeu qui apportent quelques nouveautés par rapport à son ainé comme les gels mais surtout grâce au scénario déjanté et plaisant dans l'univers si prenant d'Aperture Science. Les musiques sont également d'une grande qualité et accompagne magnifiquement bien chaque scène du jeu. Et pour la fin, et bien c'est la cerise sur le gâteau. Elle ne déçoit pas et reste même ancré dans nos mémoires par son originalité. Pour le multi, il est vraiment accrocheur. Bien ficelé pour le Gameplay et la communication avec son partenaire, il est vrai qu'il es nécéssaire d'y jouer avec un ami. On notera que la partie en multi se termine peut être trop rapidement même si les succès sont là pour ralonger la durée de vie, il n'en reste pas moins qu'il existe un manque à ce niveau. En éspérant qu'il sera comblé par les divers DLC qui arriveront (gratuitement sur PC et PS3) et surtout les maps de la communauté.
Супер игра!!

A step up from it's predecessor in almost every way, Portal 2 did not fail to disappoint. Once again, it is a short playthrough, and it does lack in replayability once you beat all the current chambers, but playing through portal 2 is an experience you're not likely to forget. The dialoge and little bits and pieces of background that they feed you about the history of aperture will keep you playing!
I think there's nothing to say here about Portal 2. Just buy it if you haven't.

Common misconception: this game is actually Portal², as in Portal squared, because there's so many portals.

A great wacky mix of scifi-horror and humor that excellently captures where you 'left off' in Portal 1. 

While the game does undo a lot of the eerie and unknown atmosphere of Portal 1, it gives way to new backstory of Chell and the Aperture labs outside of what was revealed to you by GLaDoS. 

The game's writing is superb, and the characters exemplify the clever writing that Valve so rarely utilizes to connect to players in story-oriented games. 

The gameplay aspects (especially with Co-op) make Portal 2 a fresh and experimental game with somewhat new mechanics not previously used in other source games.
One of the best games of 2011 and if you have a buddy to play through the coop mode with, it's even better.
This is one of the best games I've played. Nice sequel to Portal. I liked that this game was longer then thr first portal and the fact it expanded on the story. Oh and you gotta love Cave Johnson!

Portal 2 is not just a refined version of the awesome Portal, it's so much more and it'd be a sin not to play it, both single player and co-op mode. Fun, entertaining and has some of the best and most fun quotes you'll ever hear.
Great sequel to the already classic original game. Wonderful humour and great puzzles. I just wish the single player campaign was longer.

Valve took everything that made the original Portal truely compelling and forward thinking and gave it a sense of scope and scale that only some of gaming's greatest titles can acheived. It is unpredecented and staggering to conceive the level of detail and depth that this game delievers. This is gamings concorde moment, the industry's new yard stick. 25 years from now capable games of the genre will still be measured against this incrediable example of design, pacing, gameplay and presentation.

[h1] [b] "Most test subjects do experience some, uh, cognitive deterioration after a few months in suspension.
Now, you've been under for … quite a bit longer" [/b] [/h1]

It's back, finally.

Portal 2 takes the unexpected/unparalleled success of the last minute Orange Box filler that is Portal.
I know it's been a while, but you remember?
The game that allows you make Einstein your b***h by creating localised wormholes so you can travel instantly between two locations.

Well Portal 2 takes that winning formula and expands it without breaking and original winning format.

[b] With more: [/b]
🔸 Test rooms
🔹 Turrets - "There you are."
🔸 Obstacles - Oh. Advanced Aerial Faith Plates
🔹 Mind bending Physics - Hope you don't get motion sickness
🔸 Hazards - Crushed, Drowned, Zapped, Burnt, Shoot, Gassed, Shame
🔹 Companion cubes - Mine all Mine
🔸 Secrets - She's Watching You!
🔹 Cake - This is not a Lie

[b] What's new: [/b]
🔸 A Story - That follows on from Portal ?
🔹 Characters - Now with a mad AI
🔸 Smooth Jazz - To help you remain calm
🔹 Repulsion Gel - Bouncy Bouncy
🔸 Propulsion Gel - Zoooooooooom
🔹 Conversion Gel - Portal onto anything
🔸 Cleansing Gel - Whoops, wash away those Gels
🔹 Other Turrets! - "Uhhhh... Blam! Blam blam blam! I'm not defective!" 
🔸 Frankenturret - The unholy joining of Turret and Cubes
🔹 Singing Turrets - ???
🔸 An in game Test Chamber Creation Kit - Steam Workshop

Portal 2 is about as awesome as you can get. Everything about this game is great, and when you're done with it, there are tons of great user-made maps too! It has an amazing story, hilarious characters, a super fun Co-op, and the best gameplay you'll ever find in a game like this! Learning to think with portals was the best thing I've ever learned! :D
Brilliant and hilarious.. *-*

With Stephen Merchant's fantastic performance as Wheatley, Portal 2's story opens in some truly shocking and hilarious ways. Intelligent, witty, ridiculously quotable, and even more dark than the first, Portal 2 delivers its players an unforgettable experience along with an amazing soundtrack and a mind blowing ending. I'd recommend this game to everyone.

But do yourself a favour and play Portal 1 first.
